title: Quiz 3: Nutrition Across the Lifecycle
description: Evaluate your knowledge on nutritional needs during pregnancy, infancy, adolescence, and old age.

questions.question: Exclusive breastfeeding means feeding the baby ONLY breast milk for the first ___BLANK___ months of life.
questions.explanation: Exclusive breastfeeding is recommended for the first 6 months without any other food or liquids.

questions.question: What is 'Colostrum'?

options.text: The first thick yellowish milk rich in antibodies

questions.explanation: Colostrum is the first milk produced after birth, yellowish and thick, providing immunity and helping pass the first stool.
questions.hint: It is produced in the first few days after birth.

questions.question: Why do adolescent girls have increased nutritional requirements compared to boys? (Select the most specific reasons)

options.text: Greater physiological stress due to menstruation
They grow taller than boys on average
Iron needs increase due to blood loss

questions.explanation: Adolescent girls need extra iron due to menstruation and nutrition to prepare for potential motherhood.
questions.hint: Think about reproductive health and blood loss.

questions.question: It is necessary to give newborn babies water during the first few days if the weather is hot.
questions.explanation: Do not give water to newborns; breast milk (foremilk) provides sufficient hydration even in hot weather. Water can be dangerous.

questions.question: Match the lifecycle stage with the specific nutritional concern:

pairs.right: Decreased caloric needs, B12 absorption issues

questions.explanation: Pregnancy needs iron/folate; Infants need breast milk; Adolescents build bone mass; Elderly have slower metabolism and absorption issues.
questions.hint: Match the age to the biological need.

questions.question: Which vitamin absorption is often reduced in the elderly due to decreased stomach acid production?
questions.explanation: Stomach acid is critical for Vitamin B12 absorption. Reduced acid in the elderly leads to deficiency.
questions.hint: This vitamin is found in animal products and needs stomach acid.

questions.question: Arrange the breastfeeding steps in the correct order for a newborn:

items.text: Begin breastfeeding within the first hour

questions.explanation: Skin-to-skin first, then start within 1 hour, ensure colostrum intake, then continue on demand.

questions.question: When breastfeeding, one should let the baby finish one breast before offering the other. This ensures the baby gets both the 'fore milk' and the '___BLANK___ milk'.
questions.explanation: The 'hind milk' has more fat and satisfies the baby's hunger, while 'fore milk' satisfies thirst.

questions.question: Review the table on Elderly Nutrition. Which statement regarding their fluid intake is correct?

richContent.content:
CategoryNeed
CaloriesFewer needed
Fluids8 glasses/day
FiberImportant for bowel function

options.text: They need less fluid than younger adults
They should drink 8 glasses per day to prevent dehydration
Fluid intake is not important for the elderly
They should only drink when thirsty

questions.explanation: Elderly people should drink 8 glasses of fluid per day to prevent dehydration, tiredness, and constipation.
questions.hint: Look at the 'Fluids' row in the table.

questions.question: Adolescents who skip breakfast are at high risk for having an inadequate consumption of fiber.
questions.explanation: Breakfast often includes whole grains/cereals which are key sources of fiber.
questions.hint: Cereals are a common source of fiber.
